str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably strengthened from phrasso; a signet; by implication, the stamp impressed, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Half an hour. From the base of hemisu and hora; a half-hour.
